documentation.text:
@notice This contract acts as Octobay's storage of all Governors, proposals and associated tokens.
         It handles all of the voting on the proposals and checking on statuses of proposals.
@notice Maps gov token address to a Governor

@notice This contract acts as Octobay's storage of all Governors, proposals and associated tokens.
         It handles all of the voting on the proposals and checking on statuses of proposals.

params.payoutEth: Amount in wei of the completed bounty, used to calculate USD amount of tokens to award
params.recipient: Address of user to award governance tokens to
params.tokenAddr: Address of the governance token to award this user

castVote(address,uint256,int16).details: Anyone with > 0 amount of tokens can vote. They can vote up to and including their share (but not necessarily all).      A positive _vote is considered in favour of the proposal and a negative is considered against it.

params._govToken: Address of the gov token to use
params._proposalId: ID of the proposal to vote on
params._vote: The positive(for) or negative(against) amount of your token share you'd like to vote towards this proposal

params._creator: The address of the creator of this gov token
params._minQuorum: The minimum quorum allowed for new proposals
params._newProposalShare: Share of gov tokens a holder requires before they can create new proposals
params._newToken: The address of the governance token for this governor

params._minQuorum: The minimum quorum allowed for new proposals
params._name: Name of the new governance token
params._newProposalShare: Share of gov tokens a holder requires before they can create new proposals
params._projectId: Github graphql ID of the org or repo this governor/token is associated with
params._symbol: Symbol to use for the new governance token

returns.newToken: A reference to the created governance token

params._discussionId: The minimum quorum allowed for new proposals
params._endDate: Date in epoch secs when the voting for this proposal closes
params._govToken: Address of the gov token to use
params._quorum: The minimum percentage of gov tokens required for this proposal to pass
params._startDate: Date in epoch secs when this proposal will become active and voting is opened

params._projectId: Github graphql ID of the org or repo this governor/token is associated with
params._symbol: Token Symbol for the new token

returns._0: A reference to the created governance token

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params._govToken: Address of the gov token to use
params._proposalId: ID of the proposal whose state we should check

returns._0: The ProposalState of the given proposal

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params._govToken: The address of the governance token for this governor
params._minQuorum: The minimum quorum allowed for new proposals
params._newProposalShare: Share of gov tokens a holder requires before they can create new proposals

params._govToken: Address of the gov token to use
params._newProjectId: Github graphql ID of the new org or repo which should be used

awardGovernanceTokens(address,uint256,ad.notice: Awards (mints) governance tokens to users for completing an issue (bounty) according to USD amount of bounty

createGovernor(address,address,uint16,ui.notice: Necessary to set the parameters for new proposals and to know if we've already initialized a governor

createGovernorAndToken(address,string,ui.notice: Essentially a wrapper for createGovernor and createToken to use only one call

createProposal(address,string,uint256,ui.notice: Anyone with at least newProposalShare share of tokens or an NFT with the required permission can create a new proposal here

governorsByTokenAddr(address).notice: Maps gov token address to a Governor

updateProjectId(address,string).notice: Used in case a project wants to transfer tokens from a repo to an org in the future for example

userdoc.notice: This contract acts as Octobay's storage of all Governors, proposals and associated tokens.         It handles all of the voting on the proposals and checking on statuses of proposals.
